snippet: The Long Island county voted to realign its police precinct houses, turning half into community policing centers and reducing its payroll by 100 officers.
abstract: Nassau county votes to realign its police precinct houses, turning half into community policing centers and reducing its payroll by 100 officers; move is part of an effort to reduce a $310 million budget deficit.
lead_paragraph: The Long Island county voted to realign its police precinct houses, turning half into community policing centers and reducing its payroll by 100 officers.

headline.main: Policing Cuts Pass in Nassau County
headline.print_headline: Policing Cuts Pass In Nassau County
